snippet: Instead of buying food from American farmers and shipping it abroad, the government would buy food in developing countries and distribute it.
abstract: Obama administration announces plans to change the way United States distributes international food aid, proposing to buy food in developing countries and distribute it instead of shipping food from American farmers overseas; plan touches off intense lobbying campaign by shipping companies, agribusiness and charitable groups who say change will harm nation's economy and hamper efforts to fight global hunger.
lead_paragraph: Instead of buying food from American farmers and shipping it abroad, the government would buy food in developing countries and distribute it.

headline.seo: White House Seeks to Change International Food Aid
headline.main: Obama Administration Seeks to Overhaul International Food Aid
headline.print_headline: Obama Administration Seeks to Overhaul International Food Aid
